config.question: What was the effect of the demographic shift that occurred in late-seventeenth-century Chesapeake society?

choices.content: It led to the emergence of the planter class.
It helped to reduce the inequality that existed in society.
It helped to establish communication between the colonies in the New World.
It led to low economic dependence on tobacco.

answer_3.response: The life expectancy at the Chesapeake improved significantly, and for the first time in the history of Virginia and Maryland, important leadership positions went to men who had been born in America. This led to the rise of an indigenous ruling elite.
